content:
• Thursday, November 8, 2012
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum (NASDAQ:SPRD) -10.5% AH following its Q3 report, even though results beat estimates...

    Spreadtrum (NASDAQ:SPRD) -10.5% AH following its Q3 report, even though results beat estimates and Q4 revenue guidance of $189M-$196M is largely above a $189.9M consensus. There might be some concerns about gross margin - it rose only 20 bps Q/Q in spite of an 8.5% increase in revenue, and was down 450 bps Y/Y. GM is also expected to be flat in Q4. Growing competition in China's TD-SCDMA baseband chip market could be leading to price pressure. Shares have had a nice rally since May. CC at 8PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:07 PM
  • CAR

    Zipcar (ZIP) +24.8% AH after beating Q3 estimates. Expectations were low going in - shares...

    Zipcar (ZIP) +24.8% AH after beating Q3 estimates. Expectations were low going in - shares closed near their post-IPO low today - and the company has a heavy short interest. Total members rose 5% Q/Q and 18% Y/Y to 767K, while usage revenue/vehicle held steady at $65. Q4 revenue guidance of $67M-$71M is in-line with a $69.3M consensus. Q4 adjusted EBITDA is expected to total $4.5M-$7.5M, compared with $6.5M in Q3. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 PM
  • NWPX

    Northwest Pipe (NASDAQ:NWPX): Q3 EPS of $0.36 misses by $0.18. Revenue of $115.1M (+17.4% Y/Y)...

    Northwest Pipe (NASDAQ:NWPX): Q3 EPS of $0.36 misses by $0.18. Revenue of $115.1M (+17.4% Y/Y) misses by $22M. Shares -2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:07 PM
  • OWW

    Orbitz (OWW -7%) is up 12.3% AH as Priceline/Kayak stokes acquisition hopes. Shares made new...

    Orbitz (OWW -7%) is up 12.3% AH as Priceline/Kayak stokes acquisition hopes. Shares made new lows again today following Wednesday's disappointing Q3 report (I, II). Travelzoo (NASDAQ:TZOO) could also move in response to the deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • ENR

    Energizer (NYSE:ENR): Q3 EPS of $1.76 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $1.14B (-4.6% Y/Y) in-line....

    Energizer (NYSE:ENR): Q3 EPS of $1.76 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $1.14B (-4.6% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +6.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • IGT

    More on International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT): Q3 beats on all fronts as earnings jump 65%...

    More on International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT): Q3 beats on all fronts as earnings jump 65% Y/Y. The company raises FY13 guidance, citing a rebound in gambling and strength in its North American business. It now expects to earn $1.20 to $1.30 a share, above the $1.14 estimate from the Street. Shares +7.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • ET-OLD

    ExactTarget (NYSE:ET-OLD): Q3 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $74.7M (+35.6% Y/Y) beats...

    ExactTarget (NYSE:ET-OLD): Q3 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $74.7M (+35.6% Y/Y) beats by $2.7M. Shares +9.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • DGIT

    Digital Generation Systems (NASDAQ:DGIT): Q3 EPS of -$7.96 may not be comparable to consensus of...

    Digital Generation Systems (NASDAQ:DGIT): Q3 EPS of -$7.96 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.05. Revenue of $93.8M (+10.9% Y/Y) beats by $3.8M. Shares -3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks (NASDAQ:UBNT): FQ1 EPS of $0.15 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $61.5M (-22.3%...

    Ubiquiti Networks (NASDAQ:UBNT): FQ1 EPS of $0.15 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $61.5M (-22.3% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • IGT

    International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT): FQ4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $631M...

    International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT): FQ4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $631M (+16.9% Y/Y) beats by $43M. Shares +9.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • SD

    More on SandRidge's (NYSE:SD) Q3 results: Says it is exploring the sale of assets in the...

    More on SandRidge's (NYSE:SD) Q3 results: Says it is exploring the sale of assets in the Permian Basin, other than those associated with SandRidge Permian Trust (NYSE:PER), which produce ~24,500 boe/day. Proceeds would be used to fund SD's capital expense program in the Mississippian Play and to repay debt. SD +3.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • MDRX

    More on Allscripts (NASDAQ:MDRX): Q3 beats on the bottom line but misses on revenue as earnings...

    More on Allscripts (NASDAQ:MDRX): Q3 beats on the bottom line but misses on revenue as earnings plummet 51% on weak margins and asset writedowns. confirmed it is evaluating its strategic alternatives, including possibly being taken private, but doesn't plan to comment further unless its board approves a specific transaction. Shares +8.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • FLT

    Flight Safety Technologies (NYSE:FLT): Q3 EPS of $0.83 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $186M (+39.3%...

    Flight Safety Technologies (NYSE:FLT): Q3 EPS of $0.83 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $186M (+39.3% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares +1.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • KYAK

    Kayak Software (NASDAQ:KYAK): Q3 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $78.6M (+28.4% Y/Y)...

    Kayak Software (NASDAQ:KYAK): Q3 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $78.6M (+28.4% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Shares +32% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • EXPE

    Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE) -4.3% AH on news Priceline (PCLN) is acquiring Kayak (NASDAQ:KYAK)....

    Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE) -4.3% AH on news Priceline (PCLN) is acquiring Kayak (NASDAQ:KYAK). Investors are likely worried the direct integration of Priceline's travel listings and bidding platform with Kayak's search engine will hurt Expedia's market share. TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP) -3.3% AH, likely on concerns the Priceline deal could end its travel reviews partnership with Kayak. Priceline is holding a call to discuss the merger (webcast).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (NYSE:SD): Q3 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $532M (+46.5% Y/Y) beats...

    SandRidge Energy (NYSE:SD): Q3 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $532M (+46.5% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares +4.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 6 Comments
  • CBOU

    Caribou Coffee (NASDAQ:CBOU): Q3 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $77.2M (-5.2% Y/Y)...

    Caribou Coffee (NASDAQ:CBOU): Q3 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $77.2M (-5.2% Y/Y) beats by $2.5M. Shares -3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • HALO

    Halozyme (NASDAQ:HALO): Q3 EPS of -$0.18 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $5.3M (-76.7% Y/Y) misses...

    Halozyme (NASDAQ:HALO): Q3 EPS of -$0.18 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $5.3M (-76.7% Y/Y) misses by $0.7M. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • BKNG

    Priceline (PCLN) is acquiring Kayak Software (NASDAQ:KYAK) for $40/share, or $1.8B. The price...

    Priceline (PCLN) is acquiring Kayak Software (NASDAQ:KYAK) for $40/share, or $1.8B. The price represents a 29% premium to Kayak's close today. 1/3 of the purchased will be financed via cash, and 2/3 via stock. Priceline expects the deal to close in Q1, and have a minimal impact on 2013 EPS. Regulators may take a close look. PCLN -1.5% AH. KYAK is halted until 4:30 p.m.  (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:JAZZ): $1.29 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $175M misses by $4M. Shares...

    Jazz Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:JAZZ): $1.29 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $175M misses by $4M. Shares -1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum Communications (NASDAQ:SPRD): Q3 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $187.9M...

    Spreadtrum Communications (NASDAQ:SPRD): Q3 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $187.9M (+1.7% Y/Y) beats by $16M. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • JWN

    Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q3 EPS of $0.71 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $2.71B (+13.8% Y/Y) misses by...

    Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q3 EPS of $0.71 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $2.71B (+13.8% Y/Y) misses by $90M. Shares -3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • DLB

    Dolby Laboratories (NYSE:DLB): FQ4 EPS of $0.61 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $224.8M (-8% Y/Y)...

    Dolby Laboratories (NYSE:DLB): FQ4 EPS of $0.61 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $224.8M (-8% Y/Y) beats by $15M. Shares +4.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN): Q3 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $568.6M (+32% Y/Y) misses by...

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN): Q3 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $568.6M (+32% Y/Y) misses by $21.5M. Gross billings of $1.22B (+5% Y/Y). Expects Q4 revenue of $625M-$675M vs. $633.9M consensus. Expects Q4 operating income of $0-$20M. Shares -13.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 4 Comments
  • ESV

    Ensco (ESV -3.9%) says all of its 10 rigs in Brazil have term contracts with no early...

    Ensco (ESV -3.9%) says all of its 10 rigs in Brazil have term contracts with no early termination or termination for convenience provisions, refuting rumors that weighed on shares during the day. A recent contract signed with Petrobras (NYSE:PBR) for one rig is contracted through April 2014; ESV is in advanced negotiations for multi-year contracts on its next two rigs coming up for renewal in Brazil.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • PQ

    PetroQuest Energy (PQ +1.9%) is upgraded to Buy from Accumulate at Global Hunter, finding shares...

    PetroQuest Energy (PQ +1.9%) is upgraded to Buy from Accumulate at Global Hunter, finding shares attractive after yesterday's downward move. While PQ increased planned 2012 capex by $20M to a range of $130M-$135M, it did so to reflect an asset sales unlikely to close by year end, not in order to spend more money in Q4.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • SLXP

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP +7.5%) gets a pop today after its Q3 EPS came in well ahead of...

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP +7.5%) gets a pop today after its Q3 EPS came in well ahead of expectations and the drug developer raised its FY12 profit guidance for the third time this year. Sales of its key antibiotic drug Xifaxan jumped 43%, leaving analysts estimates in the dust. The company now expects an FY12 EPS of $3.13 on revenues of $735M, above the Street estimate of $2.89 on revenues of $739M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • HL

    Aurizon Mines (AZK -12%) plunges as Q3 earnings were hurt by a 25% drop in ounces of gold sold....

    Aurizon Mines (AZK -12%) plunges as Q3 earnings were hurt by a 25% drop in ounces of gold sold. Given the weaker than expected Q3 performance at Casa Berardi and a review of its Q4 mine plan, full-year gold production guidance was lowered to ~137K oz. from 150K oz. The shaft sinking project resulted in a lack of operational flexibility to provide the expected tonnage to the mill.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • REXX

    Rex Energy (REXX -8.6%) is downgraded to Accumulate from Buy at Global Hunter, which sees few...

    Rex Energy (REXX -8.6%) is downgraded to Accumulate from Buy at Global Hunter, which sees few catalysts with Marcellus Shale drilling activity staid for the year and limited Utica drilling activity and news flow likely for the next several months. A potentially material increase in reserve value related to ethane marketability and REXX's ATEX pipeline agreement could move shares in 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • CENJF

    Coastal Energy (OTCPK:CENJF +5.4%) is enticing traders with the prospect of the energy...

    Coastal Energy (OTCPK:CENJF +5.4%) is enticing traders with the prospect of the energy industry’s next bidding war, Bloomberg reports. Indonesian oil producer PT Pertamina reportedly sent a takeover proposal to major Coastal shareholders. Since Coastal operates mostly in the Gulf of Thailand, that nation’s state-controlled PTT could consider an offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS -4%) is following Apple (AAPL -2.8%) lower today, and is doing so in spite of...

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS -4%) is following Apple (AAPL -2.8%) lower today, and is doing so in spite of mobile chip peer Qualcomm's well-received results and guidance - shares are now down 24% since last week's FQ2 report. Cirrus' drop suggests today's Apple decline revolves around concerns about hardware sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • CEDC

    Central European Distribution (CEDC -15%) takes a hit after announcing that it's postponing the...

    Central European Distribution (CEDC -15%) takes a hit after announcing that it's postponing the filing date of its Form 10-Q for the quarterly period ended September 30, 2012, which had been expected to be filed on Nov. 9, 2012. The report indicated that the new filing date will be disclosed as soon as possible.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • EBIX

    Ebix (EBIX -3.7%) is lower following its Q3 report, even though the insurance software firm beat...

    Ebix (EBIX -3.7%) is lower following its Q3 report, even though the insurance software firm beat estimates and raised its quarterly dividend by 50% to $0.075/share. The company now sports a yield of 1.7%. A slight Q/Q drop in deferred revenue to $18.05M might not be going over well, given revenue rose 13% Q/Q. (SEC probe report: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • QCOM

    Accolades pour in for Qualcomm (QCOM +4.9%) following its strong FQ4 results (I, II) and better...

    Accolades pour in for Qualcomm (QCOM +4.9%) following its strong FQ4 results (I, II) and better guidance. A rising baseband chip ASP is going over well, and so is all the design activity seen for Qualcomm's Snapdragon processors - Canaccord believes there are 125 devices in the pipeline that will use high-end Snapdragon S4 parts. FBR is a little worried about Qualcomm's soaring R&D spending, but admits the spending will make it "increasingly difficult for smaller competitors to keep up." (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • ITW

    Illinois Tool Works (ITW -1.7%) dips after being downgraded to Hold on valuation at ISI Group...

    Illinois Tool Works (ITW -1.7%) dips after being downgraded to Hold on valuation at ISI Group earlier today. The stock has had a good run this year, up over 20% just since mid-July. The firm raises its price target however, to $67 from $62.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • JBLU

    Airline stocks rally as a number of oil analysts say they see further downward price action...

    Airline stocks rally as a number of oil analysts say they see further downward price action ahead with U.S. inventories and production high. The sector is also getting a little boost with New York-region airports recovering quickly from the latest winter storm. Advancers: JBLU +3.5%, DAL +2.6%, UAL +2.4%, LUV +1.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • PPP

    Primero Mining (PPP -4.8%) shares slide after the miner reports Q3 earnings of $0.12 per share...

    Primero Mining (PPP -4.8%) shares slide after the miner reports Q3 earnings of $0.12 per share vs. $0.19 in the prior year's quarter; revenues fell 17% Y/Y to $38M. PPP expects to achieve the mid to low end of its annual production guidance range of 110K-120K gold equivalent oz. for FY 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • CMI

    After initially opening higher, Cummins (CMI -1.5%) slides back in the face of an upgrade to...

    After initially opening higher, Cummins (CMI -1.5%) slides back in the face of an upgrade to Outperform at BMO Capital this morning. The firm cites the company's stabilizing global growth profile and pent-up demand in developed countries that should boost near-term sales. The company also ups its price target by 50%, to $120 from $79.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • MITK

    Mitek (MITK -16.3%) is staring at big losses after reporting FQ4 revenue of $1.2M (-60% Y/Y) and...

    Mitek (MITK -16.3%) is staring at big losses after reporting FQ4 revenue of $1.2M (-60% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.09 - the latter missed consensus by $0.02 - as the mobile banking software firm struggles with the fallout of its collapsed deal with USAA. In spite of the revenue drop, opex rose 30% Y/Y due to rising R&D and legal expenses. During its earnings call, Mitek noted it added 156 new financial institutions as customers in FQ4, but added large banks are taking longer than expected to roll out its software.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • IOSP

    Innospec (IOSP -2.3%) slides after potential acquisition target TPC Group (NASDAQ:TPCG) ended...

    Innospec (IOSP -2.3%) slides after potential acquisition target TPC Group (NASDAQ:TPCG) ended talks about a deal. TPC Group agreed to a revised private-equity buyout bid on Thursday.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • KGC

    Kinross Gold (KGC +5.8%) is surging after last night's better than expected Q3 results....

    Kinross Gold (KGC +5.8%) is surging after last night's better than expected Q3 results. CEO Paul Rollinson says KGC is starting a new program to maximize value at all its mines and projects. In order to control costs at Tasiast, its troubled Mauritania mine, KGC may downsize initial production and gradually ramp it up. Canaccord is encouraged enough to upgrade the stock to Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • WIN

    Telcos Windstream (WIN -8.9%) and CenturyLink (CTL +5.9%) head in opposite directions following...

    Telcos Windstream (WIN -8.9%) and CenturyLink (CTL +5.9%) head in opposite directions following their Q3 reports (I, II). While CenturyLink's EPS beat and free cash flow guidance are driving shares higher, Windstream is down after reporting a 14% Y/Y drop in adjusted free cash flow to $182M. The carrier also reported a 10% Y/Y drop in wholesale revenue, and the loss of another 22.3K voice lines. Frontier (FTR -2.1%), which fell on Tuesday following its Q3 report, is following Windstream lower. (CTL transcript) (WIN transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • PXD

    Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD -1.9%) is downgraded to Equal Weight from Overweight with a $109...

    Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD -1.9%) is downgraded to Equal Weight from Overweight with a $109 price target by Barclays, which believes strong operational momentum and expected top-quartile DAPPS growth are reflected in the ~25% premium valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharmaceutical (CPRX -62%) craters after saying earlier that CPP-109, its potential...

    Catalyst Pharmaceutical (CPRX -62%) craters after saying earlier that CPP-109, its potential cocaine addiction treatment, failed to meet its primary endpoint versus a placebo in Phase II studies. The data also showed that two key secondary endpoints, a significantly larger increase in cocaine negative urines and a significant decrease in the weekly fraction of use days in medication-treated subjects, also were not met.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • Z

    Trulia (TRLA -13.3%) has sold off after delivering an EPS miss to go with a revenue beat. Q4...

    Trulia (TRLA -13.3%) has sold off after delivering an EPS miss to go with a revenue beat. Q4 guidance, provided on the earnings call, is similar - expected revenue of $18.8M-$19.2M is above an $18.2M consensus, but adjusted EBITDA is only expected to rise to $400K-$600K from Q3's $300K, which suggests EPS will miss a -$0.07 consensus. Rising sales/marketing expenses (+68% Y/Y in Q3) are pressuring margins. Monthly unique visitors rose 50% Y/Y in Q3 to 24.9M (5.8M on mobile), and subscribers rose 34% to 22.7K. Zillow (Z -2.5%) is off in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • FE

    FirstEnergy (FE +2.3%) shares jump even as Q3 earnings fell 20% on lower revenue and sales...

    FirstEnergy (FE +2.3%) shares jump even as Q3 earnings fell 20% on lower revenue and sales volume; FE also cut the upper end of its prior EPS estimate by $0.20, and now expects $3.30-$3.40. FE says it taking actions to manage expenses and ensure cost-effective operations in light of the continued weak sales environment and low market prices for power.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • ITMN

    Shares of Intermune (ITMN +16.3%) are higher today after handily beating Q3 estimates late...

    Shares of Intermune (ITMN +16.3%) are higher today after handily beating Q3 estimates late yesterday. Net losses narrowed to $45.4M, or $0.70 per share, compared with a net loss of $38.2M, or $0.63 per share in the prior-year period. Sales of its lung-disease drug Esbriet have been strong, and the company says it expects FY12 sales to come in at or slightly above the high end of its estimated range. Canaccord ups the shares to Buy on the momentum.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • APKT

    Heavily-shorted Acme Packet (APKT +4.2%) rallies after announcing its session border controllers...

    Heavily-shorted Acme Packet (APKT +4.2%) rallies after announcing its session border controllers are now certified to work with Verizon's IP trunking services, as well as Microsoft's Lync Server unified communications platform. Acme has been hit hard this year by the impact of Verizon and AT&T's restrained wireline capex. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 2 Comments
  • DVR

    Part of Cal Dive's (DVR +7.8%) otherwise bland Q3 earnings report are details of its...

    Part of Cal Dive's (DVR +7.8%) otherwise bland Q3 earnings report are details of its restructuring plan, which it expects to result in $15M in annual cost savings, with $10M in cash cost savings, which will positively affect EBITDA. DVR says it is actively marketing for sale certain non-core assets and under-utilized facilities by year-end for proceeds up to $9M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL -18.2%) is off yesterday's AH lows, but is still down sharply due to its...

    Universal Display (PANL -18.2%) is off yesterday's AH lows, but is still down sharply due to its Q3 miss, largely the result of Samsung's decision to delay ramping its use of green and host emitter OLED materials. Wedbush has downgraded shares to Neutral, and is troubled by earnings call remarks that Samsung can roll over its minimum purchases from one year to the next. Management wouldn't provide a timetable as to when green/host emitter sales will ramp, but did note DisplaySearch expects OLED industry sales to grow 46% next year to $9.5B.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • EFC

    It's a bit apples to oranges, but what a difference there is in management attitudes from a...

    It's a bit apples to oranges, but what a difference there is in management attitudes from a couple of mortgage players: Ellington Financial (EFC +2.3%) and Annaly (NYSE:NLY). While both acknowledge the difficulty of having a non-economic gorilla (the Fed) intruding on the MBS market, Ellington (earnings, earnings call) is highly optimistic about the trading opportunities sure to arise. Annaly: "Balance sheet is not a trading vehicle."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 6 Comments
  • OSUR

    Shares of Orasure (OSUR -15.6%) get slammed after coming up just shy of estimates on its Q3 top...

    Shares of Orasure (OSUR -15.6%) get slammed after coming up just shy of estimates on its Q3 top line late yesterday and lowering its Q4 guidance. The company says that sales of its infectious disease testing, substance abuse testing and insurance risk assessment products are running below projections, and it now expects a Q4 loss of $0.15 - $ 0.13 per share on revenues of $20.5M - $21M. Street expectations are for a loss of $0.07 on revenues of $24.28M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • DVN

    Devon Energy (DVN -2.4%) is cut to Neutral from Buy at UBS following two production misses and...

    Devon Energy (DVN -2.4%) is cut to Neutral from Buy at UBS following two production misses and expectations of flat production Q/Q (Q3 earnings). The disappointing growth trajectory leads the firm to cut expected 2013 production by ~4%. DVN also raised 2012 capex for the third time this year, with only a $500M Y/Y reduction in 2013. Shares receive at least two other downgrades (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • WLL

    Whiting Petroleum (WLL +2.8%) pulls back from a big early boost on chatter that Statoil (STO...

    Whiting Petroleum (WLL +2.8%) pulls back from a big early boost on chatter that Statoil (STO -0.6%) had offered $65/share for the company. Benzinga recently reported STO came out denying the rumor, causing the subsequent drop.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • AAPL

    Though analysts have come to its defense this morning, Apple (AAPL -1.9%) can't catch a break -...

    Though analysts have come to its defense this morning, Apple (AAPL -1.9%) can't catch a break - shares now trade at 8.2x FY13E EPS (exc. cash). The decline comes as signs emerge Apple is taking new steps to vertically integrate: Digitimes reports Apple is now directly placing orders with material suppliers, who traditionally interact with manufacturers, and Horace Dediu theorizes Apple may have invested ~$2B in Sharp's display production. He also notes Apple's off-balance-sheet manufacturing/component purchase commitments have risen to $21.1B.
